Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html#/c:obj.name: +rootObjectName
Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html#/c:obj.abstract: The root object name to be used when converting this object to/from a form-encoded string.

Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html#/c:obj.name: +propertyNamesToFormFieldNamesMapping
Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html#/c:obj.abstract: This maps properties on an object that is being form-encoded into parameter names in the Tamber API.

Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html#/c:obj.name: additionalAPIParameters
Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html#/c:obj.abstract: You can use this property to add additional fields to an API request that are not explicitly defined by the object’s interface. This can be useful when using beta features that haven’t been added to the Tamber SDK yet.

Protocols/TMBObjectDecodable.html#/c:obj.name: +decodedObjectFromAPIResponse:
Protocols/TMBObjectDecodable.html#/c:obj.abstract: Parses a response from the Tamber API (in JSON format; represented as an NSDictionary) into an instance of the class. Returns nil if the object could not be decoded.

Protocols/TMBObjectDecodable.html.name: TMBObjectDecodable
Protocols/TMBObjectDecodable.html.abstract: Tamber Decodable Objects can be parsed from NSJSON Serialized API responses.

Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html.name: TMBObjectEncodable
Protocols/TMBObjectEncodable.html.abstract: Tamber Encodable Objects can be parsed to form-encoded strings

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: +defaultUser
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: Initialize empty user. TMBClient uses default user id when making relevant requests.

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: +userWithMetadata:
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: Initialize user with metadata (TMBClient uses default user id when making relevant requests).

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: +userWithMetadata:events:
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: Initialize user with metadata and events (array of TMBEventParams - user field should be empty or set to id of the given user). TMBClient uses default user id when making relevant requests.

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: +userWithId:metadata:
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: Initialize user with id and metadata (TMBClient uses default user id when making relevant requests).

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: +userWithId:metadata:events:
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: Initialize user with id, metadata, and events (TMBClient uses default user id when making relevant requests).

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: -setSaveMode:
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: Adds additional api parameter for the mode when saving a user (“merge” or “replace”).

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: events
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: List of all of the events (TMBEventParams) that are associated with the user (i.e. all passed user-item interactions).

Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.name: getRecs
Classes/TMBUserParams.html#/c:objc(cs)TM.abstract: If you would like to return new recommendations for the user, set getRecs (accepts number, page, and filter params). Note that all fields are optional, and an initialized, non-NULL TMBDiscoverParams instance (even if no properties/fields are set) will return recommendations.

Classes/TMBUser.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBUser(.name: events
Classes/TMBUser.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBUser(.abstract: List of all of the events that are associated with the user (i.e. all passed user-item interactions).

Classes/TMBUser.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBUser(.name: recs
Classes/TMBUser.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBUser(.abstract: List of all items recommended to the user.

Classes/TMBItem.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBItem(.name: tags
Classes/TMBItem.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBItem(.abstract: List of all tags assigned to the item.

Classes/TMBItem.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBItem(.name: hidden
Classes/TMBItem.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBItem(.abstract: Indicates that the item is hidden from all users.

Classes/TMBEventResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.name: events
Classes/TMBEventResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: An array of TMBEvent objects. Because the publishableProjectKey does not allow event-retrieve operations, this array will only contain the event that was tracked (on success). - see: https://tamber.com/docs/api/#event-object

Classes/TMBEventResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.name: recs
Classes/TMBEventResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: An array of TMBDiscovery objects. Is only set if the TMBEventParams passed had getRecs set.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithItem:behavior:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize user event with an item and behavior (TMBClient uses default user when tracking event).

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithItem:behavior:context:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize user event with an item, behavior, and context (TMBClient uses default user when tracking event).

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithItem:behavior:amount:context:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize user event with an item, behavior, amount, and context (TMBClient uses default user when tracking event).

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithItem:behavior:hit:context:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize user event with an item, behavior, hit boolean, and context array (TMBClient uses default user when tracking event).

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithItem:behavior:amount:created:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize user event with an item, behavior, amount, and created time (TMBClient uses default user when tracking event).

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithUser:item:behavior:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize an event with a user, item and behavior.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithUser:item:behavior:amount:created:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize an event with a user, item, behavior, amount, and created time.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithUser:item:behavior:hit:context:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize an event with a user, item, behavior, hit, and context.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +eventWithUser:item:behavior:amount:hit:context:created:
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize the full event params with a user, item, behavior, amount, and created time.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +sessionStarted
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize a session started item-less event.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +sessionEnded
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize a session ended item-less event.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +pushRendered
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize a push rendered item-less event.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +pushReceived
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize a push received item-less event.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +pushEngaged
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Initialize a push engaged item-less event.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: user
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: User associated with the event.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: item
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Item associated with the event.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: behavior
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The behavior name.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: amount
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Represents the amount that the behavior was performed. Defaults to 1.0 if not supplied.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: hit
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Indicates that the event represents a successful recommendation (ex. user ‘clicks’ an item in their recommended items list). This is used in Tamber’s analytics tools to track how recommendations impact user behavior.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: context
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The context(s) in which the event occurred. Useful for segmenting events data to determine the impact of interface elements and other contextual variables on user behavior. Also useful for A/B testing interface changes.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: created
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Time the event occurred. Defaults to the current time if not supplied.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: getRecs
Classes/TMBEventParams.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: If you would like to instantly return new recommendations for the user, set getRecs (accepts number, page, and filter params). Note that all fields are optional, and adding a non NULL TMBDiscoverParams instance will return recommendations.

Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.name: amount
Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.abstract: Represents the amount that the behavior was performed. Defaults to 1.0 if not supplied.

Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.name: hit
Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.abstract: Indicates that the event represents a successful recommendation (ex. user ‘clicks’ an item in their recommended items list). This is used in Tamber’s analytics tools to track how recommendations impact user behavior.

Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.name: context
Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.abstract: The context(s) in which the event occurred. Useful for segmenting events data to determine the impact of interface elements and other contextual variables on user behavior. Also useful for A/B testing interface changes.

Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.name: created
Classes/TMBEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBEven.abstract: Time the event occurred. Defaults to the current time if not supplied.

Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.name: +discoverRecommended:
Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The simplest way to get TMBDiscoverParams for user recommendations – only set the number of recommended items (TMBDiscovery objects) you want to return.

Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.name: +discoverRecommended:getProperties:
Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Get TMBDiscoverParams for user recommendations with given number of recommended items (TMBDiscovery objects) you want to return, and getProperties set to given value (set to true to include item properties in returned TMBDiscovery objects).

Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.name: +discoverNext:number:
Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The simplest way to get TMBDiscoverParams for up-next for a given item page. If TMBClient userId has been set, the results will be tuned for the user.

Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.name: +discoverNext:number:getProperties:
Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The simplest way to get TMBDiscoverParams for a given item. If TMBClient userId has been set, the results will be tuned for the user.

Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.name: excludeItems
Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: List of item ids to exclude from results. Useful for hiding items that are already being displayed to the user.

Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.name: variability
Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Represents the degree of variability applied to the results. Variability helps make results more dynamic, and is intelligently weighted to prioritize higher-scoring results (i.e. it does not just shuffle the results). Defaults to 0 if not supplied.

Classes/TMBDiscoverBasicParams.html#/c:o.name: +discoverRecommendations:
Classes/TMBDiscoverBasicParams.html#/c:o.abstract: The simplest way to get TMBDiscoverBasicParams for user recommendations – only set the number of recommended items (TMBDiscovery objects) you want to return.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: +apiClientWithPublishableProjectKey:publishableEngineKey:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Create a Tamber Client instance.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: +apiClientWithPublishableProjectKey:publishableEngineKey:user:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Create a Tamber Client instance.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -initWithPublishableProjectKey:publishableEngineKey:user:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Tamber initialization

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -setUser:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Set id for the user

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -getUser
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Get the current user. Returns nil if no user has been set.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -setUserPushToken:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Set the push token for the user (must set the user first)

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -setUserLocation:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Set the location for the user (must set the user first)

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -setPushDelegate:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Set the delegate for TMBPush.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -enablePush
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Enable TMBPush operation. Initializes TMBPush instance to begin handling push notification events.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -sessionStarted
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Track start of user session. Used to evaluate engagement driven by push notifications.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -disableUserPush
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Disable push notification services for the user.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -reEnableUserPush
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Enable push notification services for the user after having called disableUserPush. Push services will be enabled by default if enablePush has been called and the user has given push permissions to the app.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -trackEvent:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Track event to your project.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -createUser:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Create user in your project. IMPORTANT: You do not need to manually create users, tracking events will automatically create novel users. Manually creating a user is valuable for initializing metadata, or if you have an onboarding flow where users interact with items, you can create the user with a list of events from onboarding to seed their recommendations.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -saveUser:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Save user in your project. The metadata field will be set to the value provided, if not nil, overwriting any past metadata.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -saveUser:withMode:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Save user in your project with configurable save mode, either “merge” or “replace”. The metadata field will be set to the value provided, if not nil, overwriting any past metadata.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -updateUser:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Update user in your project. The metadata field will be set to the value provided, if not nil, overwriting any past metadata.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -retrieveUser:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Retrieve user in your project.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -retrieveUser:getEvents:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Retrieve user in your project.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -mergeToUser:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Merge from the current default user to another, transferring the tracked events / recommendations and removing the default user from the project, as well as all associated engines, and setting the TMBClient default user to the id of the new toUser. Useful for transferring a temporary user profile to a logged-in user.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -mergeUser:toUser:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Merge one user into another, removing the from user. Useful for transferring the tracked events / recommendations of a temporary user to a logged-in user.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -mergeUser:toUser:noCreate:getEvents:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Merge one user into another, removing the from user. Useful for transferring the tracked events / recommendations of a temporary user to a logged-in user.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -searchUsers:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Search for users by metadata field-values.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -discoverNext:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Retrieve the set of recommended items to display next for the given item and user (if the user is set). Discover Next is your go-to tool for displaying personalized items on item-pages (set the item to the currently displayed item).

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -discoverRecommendations:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Retrieve recommended items for the given user.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -discoverSimilar:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Retrieve similar items for the given item.

Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.name: -discoverRecommendedSimilar:responseCompletion:
Classes/TMBClient.html#/c:objc(cs)TMBCli.abstract: Retrieve similar items for the given item, that are tailored to the taste profile of the given user.

Classes/Tamber.html#/c:objc(cs)Tamber(cm.name: +setUserPushToken:
Classes/Tamber.html#/c:objc(cs)Tamber(cm.abstract: Set the push token for the user (must set the user first)

Classes/Tamber.html#/c:objc(cs)Tamber(cm.name: +setUserPushMinInterval:
Classes/Tamber.html#/c:objc(cs)Tamber(cm.abstract: Set the minimum time between push notifications for the user to override the global default.

Classes/Tamber.html#/c:objc(cs)Tamber(cm.name: +setUserLocation:
Classes/Tamber.html#/c:objc(cs)Tamber(cm.abstract: Set the location for the user (must set the user first)

Classes/Tamber.html.name: Tamber
Classes/Tamber.html.abstract: High-level wrapper for the Tamber iOS SDK.

Classes/TMBClient.html.name: TMBClient
Classes/TMBClient.html.abstract: Client for interacting with a Tamber project and/or engine via the Tamber API.

Classes/TMBDiscoverBasicParams.html.name: TMBDiscoverBasicParams
Classes/TMBDiscoverBasicParams.html.abstract: An object representing parameters used to retrieve discoveries. Not all parameters are needed for all requests. - see: https://tamber.com/docs/api/#discover

Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html.name: TMBDiscoverParams
Classes/TMBDiscoverParams.html.abstract: An object representing parameters used to retrieve discoveries. Not all parameters are needed for all requests. - see: https://tamber.com/docs/api/#discover

Classes/TMBDiscoverResponse.html.name: TMBDiscoverResponse
Classes/TMBDiscoverResponse.html.abstract: A TMBDiscoverResponse contains an array of deserialized Discovery objects.

Classes/TMBEventParams.html.name: TMBEventParams
Classes/TMBEventParams.html.abstract: Representation of a user-item interaction event. You can create event params to track events as users interact with items in your app. Novel users and items are automatically created. - see: https://tamber.com/docs/api/#event-track

Classes/TMBEventResponse.html.name: TMBEventResponse
Classes/TMBEventResponse.html.abstract: A TMBEventResponse represents an array of deserialized Event objects, and an array of deserialized Discovery objects from the Tamber API’s event endpoint. - see: https://tamber.com/docs/api/#event

Classes/TMBUserParams.html.name: TMBUserParams
Classes/TMBUserParams.html.abstract: An object representing parameters used to make user commands. Not all parameters are needed for all requests. - see: https://tamber.com/docs/api/#user

Classes/TMBUserSearchResponse.html.name: TMBUserSearchResponse
Classes/TMBUserSearchResponse.html.abstract: A TMBUserSearchResponse represents an array of deserialized User objects from the Tamber API’s user/search endpoint. - see: https://tamber.com/docs/api/#user-search
